com.percussion.error
Class PSErrorManager

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.error.PSErrorManager

public class PSErrorManager
extends Object

The PSErrorManager class is used to load the error string resources and default error pages based upon the E2 server's locale.

Error messages are broken down into ranges, assigned to the various components. The ranges we are using are as follows:

Range Component
0001 - 1000HTML - this is HTML's range of errors
1001 - 2000Server Core (including hooks)
2001 - 3000Object Store
3001 - 4000Connectivity
4001 - 5000Cataloger
5001 - 6000Back-end (DBMS) Data Processing
6001 - 7000XML Data Processing
7001 - 8000Exit Processing
8001 - 9000Server Admin

All error messages are stored using the format defined in the java.text.MessageFormat class. The message string contains curly braces around parameters, which are 0 based. The error manager provides two utility methods which take advantage of the MessageFormat.format method. The following example uses an array of arguments to generate the appropriate string: 


    String msg = PSErrorManager.getErrorText(999);

    // let's assume the returned message is:
    //    "param 1={0}, param 2 date={1,date}, param 2 time={1,time}"

    Object[] args = { new Integer(1), new Date() };

    String displayMsg = PSErrorManager.createMessage(msg, args);

    // displayMsg is returned containing:
    //    "param1=1, param 2 date=Jan 6, 1999, param 2 time=4:50 PM"
This model is excellent for internationalization as the position of the parameters may change based upon the target language.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tas Giakouminakis

init

public static void init(Locale loc)
                 throws MissingResourceException,
                        NumberFormatException
Initialize the error manager to use the specified locale. Called from server only.

Parameters:
loc - the locale to use
Throws:
MissingResourceException
NumberFormatException

init

public static void init()
Initialize the error manager to use the default locale for this system. Called from server only.

close

public static void close()
Shut down the error manager. This discards all the error page and error string information. Use the init method to re-initialize the error facility.

Create a formatted message for messages taking only a single argument.

createMessage

public static String createMessage(int msgCode,
                                   Object[] arrayArgs)
Create a formatted message for messages taking an array of arguments. Be sure to store the arguments in the correct order in the array, where {0} in the string is array element 0, etc.

Parameters:
msgCode - the error string to load
arrayArgs - the array of arguments to use as the arguments in the error message
Returns:
the formatted message

Parameters:
msgCode - the error string to load
arrayArgs - the array of arguments to use as the arguments in the error message
loc - the locale to use
Returns:
the formatted message
